title: Aerial farming services in New Zealand
creator_credit: Alert Films and Soil Conservation and Rivers Control Council
brief_description: The use of aeroplanes in schemes for restoring eroded lands to former fertility by dropping fertilizers to improve pasture and poison to combat the rabbit menace. Shows Tiger Moth aircraft being fitted to spray chemical compounds; mechanical loading of fertilizer into planes; aircraft in flight and spraying from the air. Points out the saving in time and money that results from the use of aircraft.
